original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che ni dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che ni dmigs su med do //
translated: “Subhūti, for this reason too the precious perfection is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che la ni gang gis kyang 'go ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che la ni gang gis kyang 'go ba med do //
translated: Subhūti, the precious perfection is not appropriated by anyone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang 'go bar 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs su med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang 'go bar 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs su med de /
translated: Because such a phenomenon that would be appropriated is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir na pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'go ba med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir na pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'go ba med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'o //
translated: Subhūti, therefore this perfection is the precious perfection that is not appropriated.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, if, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ltar 'du shes par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes par yang mi byed la /
translated: they do not form the perception,

original: de ltar mi rtog cing de ltar mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtog cing de ltar mi dmigs te /
translated: do not think, and do not apprehend in that way,

original: de ltar 'phro bar yang mi byed na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'phro bar yang mi byed na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: and do not proliferate in that way,🔽they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa'o //
translated: They cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni @288a *//
analyzed: de ni @288a *//
translated: That is

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: they please the lord buddhas;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par bsams shing /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par bsams shing / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: they are intent on the lord buddhas;🔽and they go from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to honor,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: revere, venerate, and worship those lord buddhas,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su spyod par byed cing /
translated: and they bring beings to maturity and purify a buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
translated: They go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang ston pa'am /🔽rnam par ston pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang ston pa'am / rnam par ston pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom does not teach any dharma at all,🔽nor does it reveal,

original: yongs su ston pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su ston pa'am /
translated: or make known,

original: 'dzin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'am /
translated: or grasp,

original: 'byin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'byin par byed pa'am /
translated: or emit,

original: skye bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: skye bar byed pa'am /
translated: or cause to arise,

original: 'gag par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'gag par byed pa'am /
translated: or cause to cease,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'am /🔽rnam par byang bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'am / rnam par byang bar byed pa'am /
translated: nor does it cause defilement,🔽nor does it cause purification,

original: 'grib par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'grib par byed pa'am /
translated: nor does it cause decrease,

original: 'phel bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa'am /
translated: nor does it cause increase,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung bar byed pa med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung bar byed pa med do //
translated: nor does it cause the past, future, or present.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: does not transcend the desire realm,

original: gnas par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa ma yin /
translated: nor does it abide in it;

original: gzugs kyi khams las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: it does not transcend the form realm,

original: gnas par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa ma yin /
translated: nor does it abide in it;

original: gzugs med pa'i khams las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: it does not transcend the formless realm,

original: gnas par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa ma yin /
translated: nor does it abide in it.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin @288b pa bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin @288b pa bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: It does not establish the perfection of generosity,

original: 'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: nor does it abandon it;

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa ma yin /🔽'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa ma yin / 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin /🔽'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin / 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bsgrub pa ma yin /🔽'dor ba ma yin /🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bsgrub pa ma yin / 'dor ba ma yin / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: 'dor ba ma yin /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, or the formless absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness that are gateways to liberation, or of the gateways of meditative stability and of the formless world.

original: 'dor ba ma yin /🔽ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the superknowledges.

original: 'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the dhāraṇī gateways or the meditative stabilities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgrub pa ma yin /🔽'dor ba ma yin /🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgrub pa ma yin / 'dor ba ma yin / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the powers of the thus-gone ones, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, or the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'dor ba ma yin /🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong @289a *//
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin / lan gcig phyir 'ong @289a *//
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the result of stream enterer.

original: ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin /🔽'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin /🔽'dor ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the accomplishment or rejection of the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, or the state of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: rang byang chub bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: it is not the accomplishment of a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: 'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: it is not the relinquishment of a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin /🔽'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin / 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: it is not the accomplishment of the knowledge of path aspects,🔽it is not the relinquishment of the knowledge of path aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa ma yin /
translated: it is not the accomplishment of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'dor ba ma yin no ////
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin no ////
translated: it is not the relinquishment of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
translated: Fascicle Forty-One

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'dus byas kyi khams 'dor ba ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'dus byas kyi khams 'dor ba ma yin /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is not the relinquishment of the compounded element,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not the accomplishment of the uncompounded element.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: whether the tathāgatas have arisen

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
translated: or whether the tathāgatas have not arisen,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa de ni de bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa de ni de bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
translated: the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, and the certification of dharmas remain just as they are.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The tathāgatas have fully awakened to that,

original: mngon par thugs su chud do //🔽mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: mngon par thugs su chud do // mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: He has realized it.🔽He has fully awakened to it.

original: mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud nas kyang gsung ngo //🔽ston to // brjod do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud nas kyang gsung ngo // ston to // brjod do //
translated: Having fully awakened to it, he teaches it.🔽He explains it.

original: 'grel to // rnam par 'byed do //🔽gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'grel to // rnam par 'byed do // gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: He elucidates it.🔽He makes it clear.

original: yang dag par ston to //🔽de nas lha'i bu stong phrag mang po steng gi bar snang la 'khod nas lhung lhung ldegs kyi sgra phyung ste /
analyzed: yang dag par ston to // de nas lha'i bu stong phrag mang po steng gi bar snang la 'khod nas lhung lhung ldegs kyi sgra phyung ste /
translated: He demonstrates it.

original: lha rdzas kyi me tog autpa la dang / padmo dang / ku @289b mud dang / punda ri ka dang / manda ra ba dang / manda ra ba chen po 'thor zhing 'di skad kyi tshig brjod par gyur to //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi me tog autpa la dang / padmo dang / ku @289b mud dang / punda ri ka dang / manda ra ba dang / manda ra ba chen po 'thor zhing 'di skad kyi tshig brjod par gyur to //
translated: Then many thousands of gods assembled in the sky above, and they let fall a rain of divine flowers, divine utpala, padma, kumuda, puṇḍarīka, and mandārava and mahāmandārava flowers, and they exclaimed:

original: kye ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pas /
analyzed: kye ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pas /
translated: “Oh! By the teaching of this perfection of wisdom

original: lha'i bu stong phrag du ma skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod pa skyes par gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i bu stong phrag du ma skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod pa skyes par gyur te /
translated: many thousands of gods have given rise to the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor ba mthong ngo //
translated: We have seen the second turning of the wheel of the Dharma in Jambudvīpa.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the elder Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: “Subhūti, because of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature

original: 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis su bskor ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis su bskor ba'ang ma yin /
translated: this wheel of the Dharma is not turned twice,

original: gcig tu bskor ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu bskor ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it turned once.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'ang chos gang yang 'khor ba'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'ang chos gang yang 'khor ba'am /
translated: And this perfection of wisdom does not stand as a support for any dharma

original: mi 'khor bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khor bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: in order to turn it or not to turn it.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said,

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos gang yang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos gang yang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: “Lord, this perfection of wisdom, which does not stand as a support for any dharma

original: mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'i slad du /
analyzed: mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'i slad du /
translated: in order to turn it or not to turn it,

original: nye bar mi gnas pa'i dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de gang lags /
analyzed: nye bar mi gnas pa'i dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de gang lags /
translated: what is that emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity is empty of the perfection of generosity.

original: nang stong pa nyid nang stong @290a *//🔽pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nang stong @290a *// pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Inner emptiness is empty of inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is empty of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are empty of the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas stong ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas stong ngo //
translated: and the noble eightfold path are empty of the noble eightfold path.🔽The noble truths,🔽the concentrations,🔽the immeasurables,🔽the formless absorptions,🔽the eight deliverances,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions,🔽emptiness,🔽signlessness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par shes pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par shes pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: and the wishlessness are empty of the wishlessness.🔽The meditative stabilizations

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: and the dhāraṇī gateways are empty of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus stong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus stong ngo //
translated: The result of stream enterer is empty of the result of stream enterer.

original: @290b lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus stong ngo //
analyzed: @290b lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus stong ngo //
translated: The result of once-returner and the result of non-returner are empty of the result of non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dgra bcom pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dgra bcom pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The state of a worthy one is empty of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub rang byang chub kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rang byang chub rang byang chub kyis stong ngo //
translated: A pratyekabuddha’s awakening is empty of a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The knowledge of path aspects is empty of the knowledge of path aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen mo ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen mo ste /
translated: this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is the great one,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: namely, the perfection of wisdom, which is empty of a basic nature.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis stong la /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis stong la /
translated: It is that all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang /
translated: And bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: dwell in the perfection of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'ang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'ang /
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar ma mchis /🔽chos kyi 'khor lo 'ang skor la chos gang yang 'khor ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar ma mchis / chos kyi 'khor lo 'ang skor la chos gang yang 'khor ba'am /
translated: but they do not fully awaken to any phenomenon at all.

original: mi 'khor ba'am /
analyzed: mi 'khor ba'am /
translated: They turn the wheel of the Dharma, but they do not turn any phenomenon,

original: rab tu 'khor bar bgyid pa ma mchis te /🔽de dag gis chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba'am /
analyzed: rab tu 'khor bar bgyid pa ma mchis te / de dag gis chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba'am /
translated: do not not turn any phenomenon,🔽and do not cause any phenomenon to be turned.🔽They do not see any phenomenon

original: yongs su ma mthong ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: yongs su ma mthong ba ma mchis so //
translated: or not see any phenomenon.”

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: It is because such a dharma that would turn around

original: mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: or not turn around

original: rab tu 'khor bar bgyi ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs su ma mchis te /
analyzed: rab tu 'khor bar bgyi ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs su ma mchis te /
translated: or turn around completely cannot be apprehended.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams @291a *//
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams @291a *//
translated: It is because all dharmas

original: cad kyang shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: cad kyang shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o //
translated: are utterly unestablished.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽stong pa nyid ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / stong pa nyid ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: Why is it so?🔽Emptiness does not cause turning around

original: mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so //🔽mtshan ma ma mchis pa ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /🔽mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so //
analyzed: mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so // mtshan ma ma mchis pa ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am / mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so //
translated: or not causing turning around.🔽Signlessness does not cause turning around🔽or not causing turning around.🔽Wishlessness does not cause turning around

original: smon pa ma mchis pa ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: smon pa ma mchis pa ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: or not causing turning around.🔽Thus, the teaching of the perfection of wisdom,

original: mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so; ;de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu bstan pa dang / bsgrags pa dang / rab tu dgod pa dang / gzhag pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang /
analyzed: mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so; ;de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu bstan pa dang / bsgrags pa dang / rab tu dgod pa dang / gzhag pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang /
translated: the demonstration, the proclamation, the establishment, the foundation, the analysis,

original: rnam par dgrol ba dang / smos pa dang / gsal bar bgyi ba dang / yang dag par bstan pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dgrol ba dang / smos pa dang / gsal bar bgyi ba dang / yang dag par bstan pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This explanation, description, clarification, detailed description, and demonstration is the pure teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de'ang sus kyang ma bstan /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de'ang sus kyang ma bstan /
translated: And that teaching of the perfection of wisdom was not taught by anyone,

original: sus kyang ma bzung ngo //
analyzed: sus kyang ma bzung ngo //
translated: and was not grasped by anyone.

original: gang sus kyang ma bstan /
analyzed: gang sus kyang ma bstan /
translated: That which was not taught by anyone,

original: sus kyang ma bzung ba de ni sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis so //
analyzed: sus kyang ma bzung ba de ni sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis so //
translated: and was not grasped by anyone, that was not realized by anyone.

original: gang sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis pa de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: gang sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis pa de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma mchis te /
translated: That which was not realized by anyone, in that there is no parinirvāṇa.

original: chos bstan pa 'di la gang su'ang sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la gang su'ang sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so //
translated: In this teaching of the Dharma, no one becomes a recipient of gifts.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u nyi shu brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u nyi shu brgyad pa'o ////
translated: This was the twenty-eighth chapter, “Teaching the Perfection of Wisdom,” from the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: shes rab @291b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab @291b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the perfection of non-existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because space does not exist.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the perfection of sameness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Because all phenomena are the same.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; 'di lta ste /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rnam par dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rnam par dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is the perfection of seclusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Because of the emptiness that transcends extremes.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni thub pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni thub pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the perfection of invincibility.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Because all phenomena are unobservable.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gnas ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gnas ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is the perfection of nonabiding.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: ming dang lus med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ming dang lus med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Because there is no name or body.”🔽Subhūti then asked,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nam mkha'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nam mkha'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is the perfection of space.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Because there is no inhalation or exhalation.”🔽Subhūti then asked,

analyzed: 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni brjod du ma mchis pa'i @292a *//
translated: “Blessed One,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is the perfection of the inexpressible.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Because there is no expression.”

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: because conceptualization and analysis are non-apprehensible.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Śāriputra then said, “Lord,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ming ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection is the perfection of non-name.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are non-apprehensible.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Śāriputra then said, “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'gro ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'gro ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection is the perfection of non-going.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all dharmas are non-going.🔽Śāriputra then said, “Lord,🔽this perfection is the perfection of non-taking.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /
translated: ” The Lord said,🔽because all dharmas are non-taking.🔽Śāriputra then said, “Lord,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection is the perfection of non-attachment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,🔽because all dharmas are non-attachment.

original: chos thams cad gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung du med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Because all phenomena are ungraspable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Śāriputra then said, “Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skad cig pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skad cig pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: is the perfection of the absence of moments.

original: chos thams cad byang zhing zad pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: chos thams cad byang zhing zad pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “Because all phenomena are purified and exhausted.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: ” Śāriputra then said, “Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis @292b bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis @292b bka' stsal pa /
translated: is the perfection of non-arising.

analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “Because all phenomena are neither born nor cease.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: ” Śāriputra then said, “Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byed pa po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: is the perfection of the absence of an agent.

original: byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “Because an agent is unobservable.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shes pa po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shes pa po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: is the perfection of the nonexistence of the one who knows.

original: shes pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “Because the one who knows cannot be apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /
translated: ” He said, “Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'pho ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: is the perfection of non-transference.

original: 'chi ba dang skye ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang skye ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “Because death and birth cannot be apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /
translated: ” He said, “Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'jig pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “Because all phenomena are indestructible.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” He said, “Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rmi lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: “This perfection of wisdom is the perfection of a dream.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Because the one who sees a dream is not apprehended.🔽” Subhūti said,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni sgra brnyan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni sgra brnyan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is the perfection of an echo.

original: @293a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @293a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

analyzed: nyan pa dang / sgrar brjod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Because the one who hears and the sound that is expressed are not apprehended.🔽” Subhūti said,

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

translated: because it is beyond all the dharmas of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽Śāriputra:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One:

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pa'o; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One:

analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all dharmas are fully and completely awakened to in every way.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u nyi shu dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u nyi shu dgu pa'o ////
translated: the nineteenth chapter is called “The Bodhisattvas.”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur te /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, thought this:🔽“Those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family who will hear this perfection of wisdom and take it up, will bear it in mind, recite it, and master it, and who will attend to it wisely, will have served the former tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.🔽Those beings who will hear this perfection of wisdom and take it up, will bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it wisely, will have planted wholesome roots under the tathāgatas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: Those beings who will hear this perfection of wisdom and take it up, will bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it wisely, will have been taken hold of by spiritual friends.

original: gang 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed pa lta ci smos te /🔽rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag @300a *//
analyzed: gang 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed pa lta ci smos te / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag @300a *//
translated: What need is there to speak of those who, having taken up, borne in mind, read aloud, mastered, and properly paid attention to this perfection of wisdom, and having taken it up, borne it in mind, read it aloud, and mastered it, then practice the perfection of wisdom just as it is taught?🔽Those sons of good family or daughters of good family who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified,

original: par mi 'gyur ba de dag gis /
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ba de dag gis /
translated: they

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yongs su dris so //
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yongs su dris so //
translated: have questioned and requested the former tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly, completely awakened buddhas.

original: yongs su zhus so //
analyzed: yongs su zhus so //
translated: They have requested them.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Those sons of good family or daughters of good family who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified,

original: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gis ni bskal pa bye ba mang por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
analyzed: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gis ni bskal pa bye ba mang por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
translated: Those who take up, hold, read aloud, master, and properly pay attention to it will practice the perfection of generosity for many millions of eons.🔽They will practice the perfections of ethical discipline, patience, perseverance, meditative stabilization, and wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas /
translated: those sons of good family or daughters of good family who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur la /
translated: are not frightened, are not terrified, and do not feel terrorized,

original: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang 'dra bar gzung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang 'dra bar gzung bar bgyi'o //
translated: Those who take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master, and properly pay attention to it will be regarded as irreversible bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
translated: this perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad pas ni /
analyzed: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad pas ni /
translated: Those who have not trained in the six perfections in the past

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu @300b phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas kyang mos par bgyi bar mi nus so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu @300b phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas kyang mos par bgyi bar mi nus so //
translated: will not be able to believe in this profound perfection of wisdom even when they hear it.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas spang bar sems pa dag gis ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs par gyur to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas spang bar sems pa dag gis ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs par gyur to //
translated: those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, think of rejecting it have already rejected this profound perfection of wisdom in the past.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: It is because those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage, when this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: dad pa dang mos pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang mos pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
translated: lack faith and conviction.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sngon gyi mthar yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos rnams la bsnyen bkur ma bgyis te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sngon gyi mthar yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos rnams la bsnyen bkur ma bgyis te /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage have not previously served the lord buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, and the śrāvakas.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice the transcendent perfection of generosity?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, the transcendent perfection of tolerance, the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, and the transcendent perfection of wisdom?

original: nang stong pa nyid ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi //
translated: How should one cultivate the emptiness of essential nature of non-entities?

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should one cultivate the applications of mindfulness?

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ji ltar @301a *//🔽bsgom par bgyi /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ji ltar @301a *// bsgom par bgyi / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: How should one cultivate the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?🔽How should one cultivate the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness, and the clairvoyances?

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su ma zhus /🔽yongs su ma dris so; ;de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su ma zhus / yongs su ma dris so; ;de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: How should they cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Śatakratu, head of the gods, then said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab na /
translated: since this perfection of wisdom is so profound,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: sngon ma spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mos par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che /
analyzed: sngon ma spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mos par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che /
translated: it is not surprising that bodhisattva great beings who have not trained in the past should not be inspired by it.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @301b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @301b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang /
translated: inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature; the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening; the four noble truths;

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative stabilizations, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,🔽and🔽wishlessness.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /🔽sangs rgyas rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mos par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che /🔽btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mos par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
