translated: and who have been taken hold of by spiritual friends

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: will believe in this profound perfection of wisdom.”🔽He said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ji tsam gyis na /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po bsnyen bkur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po bsnyen bkur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba lags /
translated: to what extent have bodhisattva great beings practiced the six perfections, produced the roots of virtue, served many buddhas, and been taken hold of by spiritual friends?”

original: bcom @325a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @325a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in the perfection of wisdom, does not construct and does not discriminate form,

original: gzugs su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽gzugs kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / gzugs kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: does not construct and does not discriminate the mark of form,

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: does not construct and does not discriminate the nature of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: He does not construct and does not discriminate feeling, perception, the mental formations, or consciousness;

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: he does not construct and does not discriminate the mark of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: he does not construct and does not discriminate the nature of consciousness.🔽He does not construct and does not discriminate the sense fields, the elements, or dependent origination;

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: he does not construct and does not discriminate the mark of dependent origination,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the nature of dependent origination.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽'dod pa'i khams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / 'dod pa'i khams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the desire realm.🔽They do not think or conceptualize about the characteristics of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the nature of the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽gzugs kyi khams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / gzugs kyi khams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the form realm.🔽They do not think or conceptualize about the characteristics of the form realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the nature of the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the formless realm.🔽They do not think or conceptualize about the characteristics of the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog @325b go ;gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog @325b go ;gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the nature of the formless realm.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the intrinsic nature of the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the perfection of wisdom’s attributes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽nang stong pa nyid du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / nang stong pa nyid du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the intrinsic nature of the perfection of wisdom.🔽They do not think or conceptualize about inner emptiness.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize about the attributes of inner emptiness.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize the nature of inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize the sign of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize the nature of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.🔽They do not think or conceptualize the sign of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin du mi @326a *//🔽rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin du mi @326a *//🔽rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think or conceptualize the nature of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the noble truths, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: signlessness, or aspirationlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the signs of the extrasensory powers.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the nature of the extrasensory powers.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the meditative stabilities or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the signs of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the nature of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the sign of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the intrinsic nature of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about , up to and including the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the sign of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad @326b mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad @326b mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: They do not form mental constructs or concepts about the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti, it is because physical forms are inconceivable.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are inconceivable.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are inconceivable.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: All the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are inconceivable.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness, and the clairvoyances are inconceivable.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are inconceivable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are inconceivable.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab bo //🔽rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po bsnyen @327a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab bo // rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po bsnyen @327a *//
translated: Up to and the knowledge of all aspects is inconceivable.

original: bkur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: bkur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba yin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is thus that bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections, producing wholesome roots, and attending on many buddhas, are taken hold of by spiritual friends.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs zab pa'i phyir /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because form is deep,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zab pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of form.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zab pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of the perfections, the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams zab pa'i phyir /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams zab pa'i phyir / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams zab pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of the emptinesses, the doors of liberation, and the applications of mindfulness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas @327b kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas @327b kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams zab pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of the formless meditative stabilizations, the doors of meditative stability, and the immeasurable.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of the perfections, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is deep because of the depth of the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of path aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po ste /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is a heap of jewels,

original: chos rin po che'i phung po rnams sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos rin po che'i phung po rnams sgrub pa'o //
translated: a heap of precious dharmas.

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the ten wholesome courses of action, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the five kinds of supernormal knowledge.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the four noble truths, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the clairvoyances,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgrub pa'o //
translated: the meditative absorptions, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgrub pa'o //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom @328a *//
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom @328a *//
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship,

original: pa nyid dang / rang byang chub sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid dang / rang byang chub sgrub pa'o //
translated: and individual enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du sgrub pa'o //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“So it is, Śāriputra, so it is.

original: gzugs dag pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /🔽stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dag pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: gzugs dag pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dag pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: the purity of form, the purity of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the purity of the sense spheres, the purity of the constituents, and the purity of dependent origination, the purity of all the perfections,🔽the purity of all the emptinesses, the purity of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the purity of the four noble truths, the purity of the concentrations, the purity of the immeasurables, the purity of the formless absorptions, the purity of the eight deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the purity of the nine serial absorptions, the purity of emptiness, the purity of signlessness, the purity of wishlessness, the purity of the clairvoyances, the purity of the meditative stabilizations, the purity of the dhāraṇī gateways, the purity of the ten tathāgata powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dag pa'i slad du /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dag pa'i slad du /
translated: because the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects are pure,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is a pure aggregate.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de lta bu bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de lta bu bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: when such a profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: bar chad mang @328b du mi 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bar chad mang @328b du mi 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: it is amazing that there are not many obstacles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bar chad mang po 'byung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bar chad mang po 'byung ste /
translated: Subhūti, this profound perfection of wisdom has many obstacles.

original: de bas na rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / bklag pa dang / bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya zhing bsgom par bya ba la bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bri na'ang myur du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / bklag pa dang / bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya zhing bsgom par bya ba la bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bri na'ang myur du bri bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of noble family or daughter of noble family, if you wish to write out, recite, teach, properly pay attention to, and meditate on this profound perfection of wisdom without obstacles, then you should write it out quickly.

original: klog pa dang bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya zhing bsgom na'ang myur du bsgom mo //
analyzed: klog pa dang bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya zhing bsgom na'ang myur du bsgom mo //
translated: If you wish to read it, teach it, properly pay attention to it, and meditate on it, then you should meditate on it quickly.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na gal te rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di zla ba gcig gis bri bar byas na'ang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na gal te rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di zla ba gcig gis bri bar byas na'ang /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, if a son of noble family or daughter of noble family wishes to write out this profound perfection of wisdom in one month,

original: des de bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: des de bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: they should write it out just like that.

original: gal te zla ba gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te zla ba gnyis sam /
translated: If in two months,

original: gal te zla ba gsum mam /
analyzed: gal te zla ba gsum mam /
translated: if in three months,

original: gal te zla ba bzhi'am /
analyzed: gal te zla ba bzhi'am /
translated: if in four months,

original: gal te zla ba lnga'am /
analyzed: gal te zla ba lnga'am /
translated: if in five months,

original: gal te zla ba drug gam /
analyzed: gal te zla ba drug gam /
translated: if in six months,

original: gal te lo'i bar gyis bri bar byas na'ang de bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lo'i bar gyis bri bar byas na'ang de bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: If it is to be written in less than a year, it should be written in that time.

original: gal te zla ba gcig gis bstan pa dang / lung dbog pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba dang / bsgom par bya na'ang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te zla ba gcig gis bstan pa dang / lung dbog pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba dang / bsgom par bya na'ang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: If it is to be taught, recited, recited aloud, properly paid attention to, and cultivated in one month, it should be cultivated in that time.

original: gal te lo'i bar gyis bsgom par byas na'ang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lo'i bar gyis bsgom par byas na'ang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: If it is to be cultivated in less than a year, it should be cultivated in that time.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar rin po che chen po la bar chad mang du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar rin po che chen po la bar chad mang du 'byung ngo //
translated: Subhūti, it is because there are many obstacles to a great jewel.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽shes rab @329a *//
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / shes rab @329a *//
translated: The Lord:🔽Subhūti, it is wonderful, it is marvelous that Māra the wicked one does not create obstacles to this deep perfection of wisdom so that it is not written out,

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ci nas kyang mi bri ba dang / mi klog pa dang / mi bstan pa dang / kha ton mi bgyi pa dang / yid la mi bgyid pa dang / mi bsgom pa'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag bar chad mi bgyid pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ci nas kyang mi bri ba dang / mi klog pa dang / mi bstan pa dang / kha ton mi bgyi pa dang / yid la mi bgyid pa dang / mi bsgom pa'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag bar chad mi bgyid pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: is not taught, is not recited, is not demonstrated, is not properly paid attention to, and is not cultivated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ci nas kyang mi bri ba dang / mi klog pa dang / mi bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la mi bya ba dang / mi bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ci nas kyang mi bri ba dang / mi klog pa dang / mi bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la mi bya ba dang / mi bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: “Subhūti, it is not that the evil Māras do not create obstacles in order to prevent this profound perfection of wisdom from being written out, read aloud, taught, properly taken to mind, and cultivated.

original: bdud sdig to can dag bar chad mi byed pa'ang ma yin mod kyi; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / bsgom pa rnams la bar chad bya bar mi nus so //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can dag bar chad mi byed pa'ang ma yin mod kyi; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / bsgom pa rnams la bar chad bya bar mi nus so // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
translated: But they are unable to create obstacles for the bodhisattva great beings who write out, read aloud, chant, and cultivate this profound perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci'i mthus na /
analyzed: ci'i mthus na /
translated: why is it🔽that the evil Māras are unable to create obstacles for the bodhisattva great beings who write out, read aloud, chant, and cultivate this profound perfection of wisdom?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bri ba dang / bklag pa dang / kha ton du bgyi ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyi ba dang / bsgom pa la bdud sdig to can bgegs bgyid par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bri ba dang / bklag pa dang / kha ton du bgyi ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyi ba dang / bsgom pa la bdud sdig to can bgegs bgyid par mi 'gyur /
translated: “Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings write out this profound perfection of wisdom, read it aloud, recite it from memory, properly pay attention to it, and meditate on it, the evil Māra will not be able to create obstacles for them.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di @329b bri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa dag la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di @329b bri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa dag la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: through the power of the Buddha, the evil Māra will not be able to create obstacles for bodhisattva great beings who write out, read aloud, recite from memory, properly pay attention to, and meditate on this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na /
translated: in all the world systems of the ten directions,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gi mthus kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gi mthus kyang /
translated: And by the power of all the lord buddhas who live, who maintain themselves, and who teach the Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bri ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa de dag la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bri ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa de dag la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: the evil Māra will be unable to create an obstacle for those bodhisattva great beings who write out, read aloud, teach, chant, properly pay attention to, and meditate on this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la dgongs shing yongs su 'dzin pa mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la dgongs shing yongs su 'dzin pa mdzad de /
translated: Those lord buddhas will also think of and look after those bodhisattva great beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who are supported by those buddha bhagavāns, who write out this deep perfection of wisdom, who read it aloud, who master it, who teach it, who recite it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa de dag la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa de dag la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: who properly pay attention to it, and who meditate on it, those ones Māra the wicked one is not able to create obstacles for.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i chos yongs su btsal ba la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i chos yongs su btsal ba la bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: it is because Māra the wicked one is not able to create obstacles for the wholesome dharmas that bodhisattva great beings who are supported by the buddhas seek.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de ni gang de ltar phyogs @330a *//
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / de ni gang de ltar phyogs @330a *//
translated: Śāriputra,🔽those who in that way in the world systems in the ten directions that are countless,

original: bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na /
analyzed: bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na /
translated: immeasurable,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med pa bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba la dgongs pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med pa bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba la dgongs pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, and samyaksaṃbuddhas who are immeasurable and countless in number, who are present, who are living, who are dwelling, and who are manifesting the Dharma, are intent on the bodhisattva great beings who are copying this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: klog cing ston pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa la dgongs pa mdzad pa ni chos nyid kyis de bzhin te /
analyzed: klog cing ston pa dang / kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa la dgongs pa mdzad pa ni chos nyid kyis de bzhin te /
translated: They are intent on those who are reading it aloud, teaching it, reciting it, properly paying attention to it, and meditating on it.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa des kyang bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa des kyang bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,🔽those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who copy this deep perfection of wisdom, read it aloud, teach it, properly pay attention to it, and meditate on it, should think, ‘It is through the power of the buddhas that I am copying this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o //
translated: I am reading it aloud.🔽I am teaching it.🔽I am properly paying attention to it.🔽I am meditating on it.’

original: klog go / ston to //
analyzed: klog go / ston to //
translated: they will read it, they will teach it,

original: kha ton du byed do //🔽chul  bzhin du yid la byed do //
analyzed: kha ton du byed do // chul  bzhin du yid la byed do //
translated: they will recite it,🔽they will pay attention to it in the correct manner,

original: bsgom mo zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom mo zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and they will meditate on it.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su yang rung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su yang rung ste /
translated: all those sons of good family and daughters of good family

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / kha ton du bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dang / bsgom mo 'tshal kun kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthu lags sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / kha ton du bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dang / bsgom mo 'tshal kun kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthu lags sam /
translated: who write out this profound perfection of wisdom, and read it, and teach it, and recite it, and pay attention to it in the correct manner, and meditate on it—all of them are through the power of the Buddha,🔽all of them are through the dhāraṇī of the Buddha,

original: kun kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzungs lags sam /
analyzed: kun kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzungs lags sam /
translated: Blessed One?”

original: @330b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @330b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so,

original: ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su'ang rung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su'ang rung ste /
translated: All those sons of good family and daughters of good family🔽who write out this profound perfection of wisdom, and read it, and teach it, and recite it, and pay attention to it in the correct manner, and meditate on it—all of them are through the power of the Buddha,🔽all of them are through the dhāraṇī of the Buddha,🔽Blessed One?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing bsgom pa de thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing bsgom pa de thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of them should be known as the power of the Buddha.

original: de thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzungs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzungs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of them should be known as the dhāraṇī of the Buddha.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid cing bsgom pa de dag ni shar phyogs nas phyogs bcu kun gyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs ma mchis pa na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid cing bsgom pa de dag ni shar phyogs nas phyogs bcu kun gyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs ma mchis pa na /
translated: those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who write out this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, and read it aloud, and teach it, and recite it, and properly pay attention to it, and cultivate it, will be endowed with the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas, the dhāraṇī that is called the ‘seal of the dhāraṇī.’

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad dang grangs ma mchis pa bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gis mkhyen te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad dang grangs ma mchis pa bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gis mkhyen te /
translated: The blessed buddhas, immeasurable and innumerable, who dwell, are alive and present, and teach the Dharma, know this.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid cing bsgom pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid cing bsgom pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who write out this profound perfection of wisdom, and read it, and teach it, and recite it from memory, and properly pay attention to it, and cultivate it,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
translated: are seen by those blessed buddhas with their buddha eyes.

original: thugs su chud do //
analyzed: thugs su chud do //
translated: They are known by them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,🔽it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha @331a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha @331a *//
translated: The sons of good family or daughters of good family🔽who write out this profound perfection of wisdom, and read it, and teach it, and recite it from memory, and properly pay attention to it, and cultivate it,

original: rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing bsgom pa de dag ni shar phyogs nas phyogs bcu kun gyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad dang grangs med pa na /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / ston cing kha ton du byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing bsgom pa de dag ni shar phyogs nas phyogs bcu kun gyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad dang grangs med pa na /
translated: Those who write out, read, teach, recite from memory, contemplate, and meditate on this profound perfection of wisdom will be protected by the gods and humans of the ten directions.🔽

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med grangs med pa bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gis mkhyen te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med grangs med pa bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gis mkhyen te /
translated: Those who write out, read, teach, recite from memory, properly pay attention to, and cultivate this profound perfection of wisdom, they are known by the immeasurable, countless lord buddhas dwelling, supporting, and living in the immeasurable, countless world systems in the ten directions, from the east to the end.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
translated: The lord buddhas see them with the eye of the buddhas.

original: thugs su chud do ////
analyzed: thugs su chud do ////
translated: They understand them.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi bcu gsum pa; sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu gsum pa; sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra!

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang /🔽bsgom pa dang / de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag gis kyang 'di ltar bdag cag ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bsgom pa dang / de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag gis kyang 'di ltar bdag cag ni /
translated: “Those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who take up this deep perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, properly pay attention to it,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur to zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur to zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and meditate on it and make it into practice just as it is should know that they are close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽gang yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te 'chang ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / gang yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te 'chang ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: mos pa mang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mos pa mang bar 'gyur te /
translated: those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who write out this deep perfection of wisdom, make it into a book, and bear it in mind will have a lot of interest in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag shes rab kyi pha @331b rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gror byed /
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyi pha @331b rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gror byed /
translated: They will honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to this profound perfection of wisdom with many flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags.🔽They will honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to this profound perfection of wisdom with many flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags.

original: bkur stir byed /🔽bsti stang du byed /🔽mchod par byed do //
analyzed: bkur stir byed / bsti stang du byed / mchod par byed do //
translated: They will honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to this profound perfection of wisdom with many flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags.

original: de ltar rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris shing 'chang ba de dag kyang de na che ba dang / legs pa che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / rnam par smin pa che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris shing 'chang ba de dag kyang de na che ba dang / legs pa che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / rnam par smin pa che bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that way, those sons of good family and daughters of good family who write out and keep this profound perfection of wisdom will have greatness, great goodness, great results, and great maturation.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yongs su non gyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba des nam yang ngan song du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yongs su non gyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba des nam yang ngan song du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: those sons of good family and daughters of good family will never be reborn in the lower realms through that root of virtue until they reach the irreversible level.

original: nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never be separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur🔽ro // nang stong pa nyid dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro // nang stong pa nyid dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Śāradvatīputra,🔽those sons and daughters of good family will never be separated from the six perfections, from the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang @332a *//
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang @332a *//
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven limbs of awakening, and the noble eightfold path;

original: nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he will never be separated from the four noble truths,🔽the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /🔽mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang; mngon par shes pa rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang; mngon par shes pa rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, and the clairvoyances;

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he will never be separated from the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never be separated from the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,🔽after the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa,

original: lho phyogs kyi rgyud na spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi rgyud na spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: this transcendent perfection of wisdom will spread in the southern region.

original: de na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma dag mos pa dam pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma dag mos pa dam pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri bar 'gyur /
translated: There, the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas will copy this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom with the highest motivation,

original: 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: they will hold it,🔽they will bear it in mind,🔽they will recite it,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: they will master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur te /
translated: and they will attend to it in the correct manner.

original: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs @332b dang; rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gror byed /🔽bkur stir byed /🔽bsti stang du byed /
analyzed: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs @332b dang; rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gror byed / bkur stir byed / bsti stang du byed /
translated: They will honor them with flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, powders, clothing, parasols, victory banners, and flags.🔽They will respect them,

original: mchod par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: revere them, and make offerings to them.

original: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des nam yang ngan song log par ltung bar mi 'dong ste /
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des nam yang ngan song log par ltung bar mi 'dong ste /
translated: Through those roots of virtue, they will never go to the lower realms.

original: de dag gis lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa myong zhing /
analyzed: de dag gis lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa myong zhing /
translated: They will experience the perfect happiness of gods and humans.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become exalted through the six perfections.

original: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis mngon par 'phags par gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis mngon par 'phags par gyur nas /
translated: Having become exalted through those six perfections,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa byed cing /
translated: they will honor, respect, revere, and make offerings to the lord buddhas.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: They will not go to the śrāvaka vehicle

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: and the unsurpassed, perfect, complete Awakening yāna.

original: theg pa gsum pos rim gyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa gsum pos rim gyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will gradually pass into nirvāṇa by means of the three yānas.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lho phyogs kyi rgyud nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lho phyogs kyi rgyud nas /
translated: in this way this deep perfection of wisdom will be practiced in the southern region,

original: yul bar ta ni na spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul bar ta ni na spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: in the country of Bārāṇasī.

original: de na yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang; dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag mos pa dam pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de na yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang; dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag mos pa dam pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri bar 'gyur /
translated: There, too, monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen in the Bodhisattva Vehicle will copy this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: will take it up,🔽will bear it in mind,🔽will recite it,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: will master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur /
translated: and will properly pay attention to it.
